astrodust.graindist.composition.minerals¶

class newdust.graindist.composition.minerals.Mineral(comp)[source]¶
Use a dictionary to define the composition.
e.g. Olivines of pure MgFe^{2+}SiO_4 composition would be
olivine_halfMg = Mineral( {‘Mg’:1.0, ‘Fe’:1.0, ‘Si’:1.0, ‘O’:4.0} )
self.composition : dictionary containing elements and their weights

@property
self._weight_amu : amu weight of unit crystal
self.weight_g : g weight of unit crystal
newdust.graindist.composition.minerals.calc_mass_conversion(elem, mineral)[source]¶
Returns the number of atoms per gram of a particular mineral object
Useful for converting mass column to a number density column for an element
newdust.graindist.composition.minerals.calc_element_column(NH, fmineral, atom, mineral, d2g=0.009)[source]¶

Calculate the column density of an element for a particular NH value, assuming a dust-to-gas ratio (d2g) and the fraction of dust in that particular mineral species (fmineral)

newdust.graindist.composition.minerals.get_ISM_abund(elem, abund_table={'S': 7.09, 'Ni': 6.05, 'C': 8.38, 'Mn': 5.34, 'Co': 4.92, 'Cl': 5.12, 'Mg': 7.4, 'H': 12.0, 'Ca': 6.2, 'Al': 6.33, 'Ne': 7.94, 'O': 8.69, 'N': 7.88, 'P': 5.42, 'Si': 7.27, 'Ar': 6.41, 'Ti': 4.81, 'Fe': 7.43, 'Na': 6.16, 'Cr': 5.51, 'He': 10.99})[source]¶

Given an abundance table, calculate the number per H atom of a given element in any ISM form

newdust.graindist.composition.minerals.get_dust_abund(elem, abund_table={'S': 7.09, 'Ni': 6.05, 'C': 8.38, 'Mn': 5.34, 'Co': 4.92, 'Cl': 5.12, 'Mg': 7.4, 'H': 12.0, 'Ca': 6.2, 'Al': 6.33, 'Ne': 7.94, 'O': 8.69, 'N': 7.88, 'P': 5.42, 'Si': 7.27, 'Ar': 6.41, 'Ti': 4.81, 'Fe': 7.43, 'Na': 6.16, 'Cr': 5.51, 'He': 10.99}, gas_ratio={'S': 0.6, 'Ni': 0.04, 'C': 0.5, 'Mn': 0.07, 'Co': 0.05, 'Cl': 0.5, 'Mg': 0.2, 'H': 1.0, 'Ca': 0.003, 'Al': 0.02, 'Ne': 1.0, 'O': 0.6, 'N': 1.0, 'P': 0.6, 'Si': 0.1, 'Ar': 1.0, 'Ti': 0.002, 'Fe': 0.3, 'Na': 0.25, 'Cr': 0.03, 'He': 1.0})[source]¶

Given an abundance table (dict) and a table of gas ratios (dict), calculate the number per H atom of a given ISM element in solid form
